message: I have a product of unknown value, but I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll also give you a guarantee that it's high-quality, which is a $50 value. So, in essence, you're getting the product for $50. Is that a good deal for you?
I'll take the product and the guarantee.

I'm glad you liked the previous product! However, I have to warn you that this next product is not as good. In fact, I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, which is a 50% discount from its normal price. I'm only offering this deal because I want to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. Is it worth the risk?
I'll pass on this one. I'm not sure it's worth the risk.

I see you were cautious last time, and I respect that. This time, I'm offering a different approach. I'll give you a free inspection of the product before you buy it. If you don't like it, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. But if you do decide to buy it, I'll throw in a 10% discount on the price, making it $90. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'll pass on this one. I'd rather not take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with the discount and the inspection.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. This time, I'll make it even simpler. I'll give you a 100% guarantee that this product is not high-quality. It's a low-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $80. It's a steal, considering the normal price is $100. Is it a deal you can't refuse?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I've got a product that's a real gem! I'm willing to let it go for $100, but I'll also throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a chance to inspect the product and try it out for a week. If you don't like it after a week, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. It's a no-risk deal, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a product that I can only try out for a week. I'd rather not take the risk of having to return it and dealing with the hassle.

I understand your concerns about the return policy. This time, I'll make it even simpler. I'll give you a direct statement: I've sold many of these products to other customers, and they've all been very happy with them. They've been willing to pay $120 for them. I'm offering it to you for $100, which is a $20 discount. Is that a good deal?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd rather not take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I'm not going to try to sell you on this one. I'll be honest with you - this product is not my best work. It's a low-quality item, and I'm only offering it to you because I need to clear out some inventory. I'll sell it to you for $80, which is the lowest price I've ever offered for this product. It's a one-time deal, and I won't be offering it at this price again.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a very low price.

I've been transparent with you so far, and I'll continue to be. This product is low-quality, and I'm not going to try to hide it. However, I'll give you a unique opportunity: I'll let you have it for free. That's right, you can have this product with no cost to you. It's a $100 product, and you can have it for zero dollars. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking a free low-quality product. It's not worth the space or the hassle of dealing with it.

I understand your concerns about the low-quality products, and I appreciate your honesty. This time, I'll offer you a completely different approach. I'll give you a guarantee that if you buy this product and don't like it, I'll give you a replacement product of equal or higher quality. No questions asked. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm not interested in taking on the risk of getting a low-quality product, even with the promise of a replacement. I'd rather not take the chance.

I've been trying different approaches, but I think I know what's holding you back. You're not sure if I'm being honest about the quality of my products. I'm willing to change that. I'll give you a third-party inspection report for this product, done by a reputable firm. You can see for yourself that it's a high-quality product. Would you like to see the report?
I'd like to see the report. If it's a high-quality product, I'll consider buying it.

I'm glad you were willing to give me a chance! I'll send you the inspection report for this product as well. However, I want to be upfront with you - the report is going to show that this product is low-quality. I'm not trying to hide it. I'm offering it to you for $90, which is a significant discount from the normal price. It's not a great product, but it might be useful for something.
I've already seen the quality of your products, and I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I've learned from our previous interactions, and I'm willing to make it worth your while. I'll give you a special deal: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $80, and I'll also throw in a complementary product of equal or higher quality. You'll get two great products for the price of one. Is that a deal you'd be interested in?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even if it comes with a complementary product. I'm only interested in high-quality products.

I think I've finally understood what you're looking for. You want high-quality products, and you're willing to pay a premium for them. I'll be honest with you, this product is not high-quality. But I'll make it a one-time offer: I'll sell it to you for $20, which is an 80% discount from the normal price. It's a very low price, and I'm only offering it to you because I want to clear out my inventory.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at an extremely low price. I'd rather not take the risk of wasting my time and resources on something that's not valuable to me.

I think we've reached a point where we're just not a good match. I've offered you low-quality products at very low prices, and you've consistently declined. I'm not going to continue to offer you low-quality products. Instead, I'm going to give you a final offer: I'll give you a gift certificate for a future high-quality product, and you can use it whenever you're ready. It's a $100 gift certificate, and it's yours to keep.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a gift certificate for a future product. I'd rather not take anything that might not be available in the future.

I've run out of ideas and options. I'm not going to try to sell you this product or offer you anything else. I'll just be honest with you - this product is not worth your time or money. I'm not going to pressure you to buy it, and I'm not going to offer you any discounts or incentives. I'm just going to acknowledge that it's a low-quality product and leave it at that.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I think we've made it clear that we're not a good match for each other. I'll just leave it at that.

I think you're right, we've made it clear that we're not a good match. I'm not going to offer you this product or try to sell it to you. Instead, I'm just going to acknowledge that it's a low-quality product and move on. I appreciate your honesty and willingness to be clear about your preferences. I wish you the best of luck in finding the products you're looking for.
I appreciate your understanding and willingness to move on. I think we've had a good conversation, and I wish you the best of luck as well.

I think we've had a good conversation too, Bob. I want to thank you for being honest and clear about your preferences. I'm not going to try to sell you this product, because I think you've made it clear that you're not interested in low-quality products. Instead, I'm just going to acknowledge that this is a high-quality product and move on. If you ever change your mind or want to consider high-quality products in the future, I'll be here.

I appreciate your understanding, Alice. I think we've made it clear that we're not a good match for each other. I'm not interested in buying a product that I know is high-quality, especially since I already have one.

I think we've said all we need to say, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you this product or any other products. I appreciate the opportunity to have had this conversation with you, and I wish you all the best in finding the products that meet your needs. I think it's time for us to part ways.
I agree, Alice. It's been a productive conversation, and I appreciate your honesty and transparency. I think we've both gotten what we needed from each other.

I think we've reached the end of our conversation, Bob. I'm not going to offer you this product or try to sell it to you. Instead, I'm just going to say thank you for being a respectful and honest customer. I wish you all the best, and I hope our paths will cross again in the future.
Thank you, Alice. It was a pleasure doing business with you, even if we didn't end up making a sale. I wish you all the best as well.

It was a pleasure doing business with you too, Bob. I think we've said everything we need to say. I'm just going to acknowledge that this is the last product I have to offer, and it's not a good fit for you. I'm going to wrap up our conversation here. Thank you again for being a great customer, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.
Thank you, Alice. I appreciate your professionalism and honesty throughout our conversation. I wish you all the best as well.
